<Title />

For projects more closely related to marketing materials, we use two typefaces: Graphik Condensed Black and Clarendon URW. They are stylistically different, but work well together to deliver our messages effectively.

## Graphik Condensed Black

Use the `.miz-graphik` class to set a block of text in Graphik.

### Style available

<p className="miz-graphik miz-text--lg">Graphik Condensed Black</p>

### Characters

<p className="miz-graphik miz-text--lg border miz-space--inset-sm">A&thinsp;B&thinsp;C&thinsp;D&thinsp;E&thinsp;F&thinsp;G&thinsp;H&thinsp;I&thinsp;J&thinsp;K&thinsp;L&thinsp;M&thinsp;N&thinsp;O&thinsp;P&thinsp;Q&thinsp;R&thinsp;S&thinsp;T&thinsp;U&thinsp;V&thinsp;W&thinsp;X&thinsp;Y&thinsp;Z<br />a&thinsp;b&thinsp;c&thinsp;d&thinsp;e&thinsp;f&thinsp;g&thinsp;h&thinsp;i&thinsp;j&thinsp;k&thinsp;l&thinsp;m&thinsp;n&thinsp;o&thinsp;p&thinsp;q&thinsp;r&thinsp;s&thinsp;t&thinsp;u&thinsp;v&thinsp;w&thinsp;x&thinsp;y&thinsp;z<br />1&thinsp;2&thinsp;3&thinsp;4&thinsp;5&thinsp;6&thinsp;7&thinsp;8&thinsp;9&thinsp;0&thinsp;&amp;&thinsp;@&thinsp;.&thinsp;,&thinsp;?&thinsp;!&thinsp;’&thinsp;“&thinsp;”&thinsp;(&thinsp;)&thinsp;*&thinsp;^&thinsp;$&thinsp;¢</p>

## Clarendon URW

Use the `.miz-clarendon` class or one of its variants to set a block of text in Clarendon.

### Styles available

<ul className="mizpl-fontstyles-list miz-text--lg border miz-space--inset-md list-unstyled">
  <li className="miz-clarendon">Clarendon URW Regular</li>
  <li className="miz-clarendon miz-clarendon--oblique">Clarendon URW Oblique</li>
  <li className="miz-clarendon miz-clarendon--bold">Clarendon URW Bold</li>
  <li className="miz-clarendon miz-clarendon--bold miz-clarendon--oblique">
    Clarendon URW Bold Oblique
  </li>
</ul>

### Characters

<p className="miz-clarendon miz-text--lg border miz-space--inset-sm">A&thinsp;B&thinsp;C&thinsp;D&thinsp;E&thinsp;F&thinsp;G&thinsp;H&thinsp;I&thinsp;J&thinsp;K&thinsp;L&thinsp;M&thinsp;N&thinsp;O&thinsp;P&thinsp;Q&thinsp;R&thinsp;S&thinsp;T&thinsp;U&thinsp;V&thinsp;W&thinsp;X&thinsp;Y&thinsp;Z<br />a&thinsp;b&thinsp;c&thinsp;d&thinsp;e&thinsp;f&thinsp;g&thinsp;h&thinsp;i&thinsp;j&thinsp;k&thinsp;l&thinsp;m&thinsp;n&thinsp;o&thinsp;p&thinsp;q&thinsp;r&thinsp;s&thinsp;t&thinsp;u&thinsp;v&thinsp;w&thinsp;x&thinsp;y&thinsp;z<br />1&thinsp;2&thinsp;3&thinsp;4&thinsp;5&thinsp;6&thinsp;7&thinsp;8&thinsp;9&thinsp;0&thinsp;&amp;&thinsp;@&thinsp;.&thinsp;,&thinsp;?&thinsp;!&thinsp;’&thinsp;“&thinsp;”&thinsp;(&thinsp;)&thinsp;*&thinsp;^&thinsp;$&thinsp;¢</p>

**Special use**

When Clarendon is used in a heading to divide sections of text, you may use an optional class of `.miz-fill--gold` to add a gold background fill.

<Canvas>
  <h1 className="miz-clarendon miz-fill--gold miz-space--inset-md">This is a Clarendon heading with background color</h1>
  <h2 className="miz-clarendon miz-fill--gold miz-space--inset-md">This is a Clarendon heading with background color</h2>
  <h3 className="miz-clarendon miz-fill--gold miz-space--inset-md">This is a Clarendon heading with background color</h3>
